error.signature: Warning: Function components cannot be given refs. Attempts to access this ref will fail. Did you mean to use React.forwardRef()?
error.regex: Function components cannot be given refs|Did you mean to use React\.forwardRef|forwardRef.*render functions.*accept

verdict.summary: A ref is passed to a function component that does not use forwardRef(). Function components do not support ref prop directly in React <19.

dead_ends.action: Pass ref as a differently named prop (e.g., innerRef)
dead_ends.why_fails: Breaks convention, does not work with third-party libraries expecting standard ref prop, and makes the API inconsistent

dead_ends.action: Convert the function component to a class component to support refs
dead_ends.why_fails: Unnecessary migration; loses hooks support and modern React patterns. forwardRef is the intended solution.

workarounds.action: Wrap the function component with React.forwardRef()
workarounds.how:
const MyComponent = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => { return
{props.children}
; });

workarounds.action: In React 19+, use ref as a regular prop without forwardRef
workarounds.how:
function MyComponent({ ref, children }) { return
{children}
; }

leads_to.condition: When migrating to React 19 where forwardRef is deprecated

preceded_by.condition: When restructuring component to use hooks and forgetting to add forwardRef

frequently_confused_with.distinction: react-forward-ref-error is about not using forwardRef when it is needed, while forward-ref-deprecation is about forwardRef being deprecated in React 19
